body: The following new advanced rogue talents can be selected by any rogue of 10th level or higher who meets the prerequisites.
name: Advanced Rogue Talents
url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents

sections.body: Once per day, when the rogue would be reduced to 0 or fewer hit points by a melee attack, she can take a 5-foot step as an immediate action. If the movement takes her out of the reach of the attack, she takes no damage from the attack. The rogue is staggered for 1 round on her next turn.
sections.name: Another Day
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Another Day

sections.body: A rogue with this talent can apply two doses of poison to a weapon at once. These can be separate poisons, in which case they both affect the target individually, or two doses of the same toxin, in which case the poisons' frequency is extended by 50% and the save DC increases by +2. This talent is an exception to the rule that injury poisons can only be delivered one dose at a time.
sections.name: Deadly Cocktail
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Deadly Cocktail

sections.body: Whenever a rogue with this talent uses the powerful sneak rogue talent, she treats all 1s and 2s on the sneak attack damage dice as 3s. A rogue must have the powerful sneak rogue talent before choosing this talent.
sections.name: Deadly Sneak**
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Deadly Sneak**

sections.body: When a rogue with this talent hits a creature with a melee attack that deals sneak attack damage, the target cannot take a 5-foot step until the beginning of the rogue's next turn.
sections.name: Entanglement of Blades**
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Entanglement of Blades**

sections.body: When a rogue with this talent uses Acrobatics to move at full speed through a threatened square without provoking an attack of opportunity, the DC of the Acrobatics check does not increase by 10.
sections.name: Fast Tumble
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Fast Tumble

sections.body: When a rogue with this talent constructs a mechanical trap, she only pays 75% of the normal cost.
sections.name: Frugal Trapsmith
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Frugal Trapsmith

sections.body: Once per day, a rogue with this talent can designate a single enemy she is adjacent to as her prey. Until the end of her next turn, she can add her sneak attack damage to all attacks made against her prey, even if she is not flanking it or it is not flat-footed.
sections.name: Hunter's Surprise
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Hunters Surprise

sections.body: Once per day, the rogue can forgo her sneak attack damage to attempt to knock out an opponent. She must declare the use of knock-out blow before she makes the attack. If the attack hits, it does normal damage, but instead of dealing sneak attack damage (and instead of any effect that triggers when the rogue deals sneak attack damage), the target falls unconscious for 1d4 rounds. A successful Fortitude save reduces this effect to staggered for 1 round. The DC of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the rogue's level + the rogue's Intelligence modifier.
sections.name: Knock-Out Blow
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Knock-Out Blow

sections.body: Once per day, a rogue with this talent gains a +10 bonus on a single Disguise check.
sections.name: Master of Disguise
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Master of Disguise

sections.body: Once per day, when a rogue with this talent is hit with a melee attack, she can redirect the attack to strike at an adjacent creature with a free action. The creature targeted must be within melee reach of the attack that hit the rogue, and the creature that made the attack against the rogue must make a new attack roll against the new target.
sections.name: Redirect Attack
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Redirect Attack

sections.body: When a rogue with this talent uses the Stealth skill to snipe, she only suffers a –10 penalty on the Stealth check, instead of –20.
sections.name: Stealthy Sniper
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Stealthy Sniper

sections.body: Once per day, a rogue with this talent can reroll a Knowledge, Sense Motive, or Perception skill check to try to gain new or better information from the roll. This reroll can be made any time during the same day as the original check.
sections.name: Thoughtful Reexamining
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Rogue/Advanced Rogue Talents/Thoughtful Reexamining
